H0.text: A plant cell has DNA that is not bound in a nuclear membrane.

H1.text: A protist cell has DNA that is not bound in a nuclear membrane.

H2.text: An animal cell has DNA that is not bound in a nuclear membrane.

H3.text: A prokaryote cell has DNA that is not bound in a nuclear membrane.

A4.text: The genome in a prokaryote is held within a DNA/protein complex in the cytosol called the nucleoid, which lacks a nuclear envelope.

A5.text: Prokaryotes as a group lack nuclei, mitochondria, and most of the other distinct organelles that characterize the eukaryotic cell.
